intro: Malapoenna ferruginea, commonly known as the iron rust tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark that resembles rusted iron. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive reddish-brown underside. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by round, woody fruits containing several seeds. This plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
